intro: Strychnos neglecta, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, woody capsules that contain toxic seeds, which are a key feature of its botanical profile. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it is typically handled with care in cultivation.
